p: For mass spectrometry ( Supplementary Figure S5A) and reciprocal co-IP experiments ( Supplementary Figure S5B,C), we used mild lysis and wash buffers, slightly modified from a previous study [ 54]. Mild lysis buffer consisted of 20 mM K-HEPES buffer pH 7.4, 100 mM NaOAc, 2 mM MgCl 2, 0.1% ( v/ v) Tween 20, 250 mM NaCl, 0.5% ( v/ v) Triton X-100, 4 μg/mL DNase I (QIAgen, Hilden, Germany), 2 μg/mL RNase A (QIAgen), 1/200 ( v/ v) each phosphatase inhibitor cocktails 2 and 3 (Sigma-Aldrich), and 1/100 ( v/ v) protease inhibitor mixture (Sigma-Aldrich). We incubated cleared cell lysate with 1–2 µg of primary antibody, rotated the mixture at 4 °C for 2–4 h, and then added 40 µL of Protein A/G PLUS-Agarose beads (Santa Cruz Biotechnology), and rocked at 4 °C overnight. Wash buffer consisted of 20 mM K-HEPES pH 7.4, 100 mM NaOAc, 2 mM MgCl 2, 0.1% ( v/ v) Tween 20, 500 mM NaCl, and 0.5% ( v/ v) Triton X-100. We washed bead–antibody complexes four times with wash buffer, twice with PBS, and eluted proteins as described above.
